etymologies: late Middle English (in vegetative (sense 2)): from Old French vegetatif, -ive or medieval Latin vegetativus (see vegetate)

definitions: relating to or denoting reproduction or propagation achieved by asexual means, either naturally (budding, rhizomes, runners, bulbs, etc.) or artificially (grafting, layering, or taking cuttings)
shortDefinitions: of reproduction or propagation achieved by asexual means

definitions: relating to or concerned with growth rather than sexual reproduction

examples.text: environmental factors trigger the switch from vegetative to floral development

shortDefinitions: relating to or concerned with growth rather than sexual reproduction

definitions: relating to vegetation or plant life
shortDefinitions: relating to vegetation or plant life

definitions: (of a person) alive but comatose and without apparent brain activity or responsiveness.
shortDefinitions: (of person) alive but comatose and without apparent brain activity or responsiveness
